abstract: Op-Ed article by Human Rights Watch researcher Nicholas McGeehan points to numerous examples of United Arab Emirates denying artists and writers critical of its exploitative labor system entry into country as evidence that it is unwilling to tolerate debate and criticism; criticizes Louvre, Guggenheim and New York University for giving veneer of respectability to authoritarian state's Saadiyat Island art project.
lead_paragraph: Abu Dhabi is opening cultural centers, but is barring artists and writers from entering.

headline.main: Art and Hypocrisy in the Gulf
headline.print_headline: Art and Hypocrisy in the Gulf

snippet: Abu Dhabi is opening cultural centers, but is barring artists and writers from entering.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
